p: MAM also has potential DNase activity. The seven different amino acids located at the N-terminus of MAM may represent the putative DNase homology region; and substituting one of these amino acids is sufficient to eliminate the enzymatic reaction [ 292], revealing that the homology region in the MAM N-terminus is important for maintaining its DNase activity. However, this nuclease activity was not substantially reduced in knockout strains [ 299], indicating that MAM is not the major nuclease in the culture supernatant filtrates.
